data.title: Context menu not dismissed with esc
data.body:
Ref #8229
1. Any editor, open https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/index.html
2. Trigger context menu with left click, esc to close it -> ignored
3. You can even type in the editor while the context menu is open which can lead to strange experiences

This behaves nicer in vscode, esc dismisses context menu, typing is disabled (it focuses actions in the context menu)

data.title: Preview is in stale state after undoing changes in source from Git view
data.body:
#7945

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a .md file (You can use the one in vscode workspace)
2. Open the preview on the right
3. Delete some content in the source and observe the preview is also updated
4. Close the source file
5. Go to Git view and undo the changes done to the source file

Observe that preview is still stale

data.title: A tiny little ambiguity problem with markdown in comments
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.2.1 - OS Version: OS X 10.11.3 This is a very tiny ambiguity with the markdown's grammar inside a comment. I think it's maybe nothing and not even worth checking but I think having a slash scape sequence would be nice.

data.title: Context menu + scrolling moves the context menu to unexpected locations
data.body:
Ref: #8229
1. Any browser, open https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/index.html
2. Trigger context menu and while the context menu is open scroll using the mouse
3. The context menu follows the mouse
4. I would expect similar behavior to vscode - where scroll is disabled if context menu is shown

![contextmenu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16419118/d011a066-3d4c-11e6-86d9-3ec2ca24b598.gif)

data.title: Open Preview action on a markdown file is not shown when right clicking on the file in tabs mode
data.body:
#7945

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Enable Tabs
2. Open any md file
3. Right click on the file title to open preview
4. Right click on the source file again (Note that source file is not in focus)

Open preview action is not shown

![screen shot 2016-06-28 at 4 21 19 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/16418987/5ddd5e40-3d4c-11e6-9e05-bc143bd61a86.png)

data.title: vscode.previewHtml is not correctly validated
data.body: Testing #8194

data.title: [launch] variable substitution replaces full content
data.body:
Testing #8196

Have the following node launch configuration. Note the preLaunchTask

```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/app.js",       
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "preLaunchTask": "npm test ${command.PickProcess}",
            "runtimeExecutable": null,
            "runtimeArgs": ["--nolazy"],
            "env": {
                "NODE_ENV": "development"
            },
            "externalConsole": false,
            "sourceMaps": false,
            "outDir": null
        }
}
```

Launch and pick a node process.
It will return error:
`Could not find the preLaunchTask '15619'.`
should be
`Could not find the preLaunchTask 'npm test 15619'.`

From trying the variable at different places such as cwd I had the impression that the variable would always replace the full string content.

data.title: Replace: is very slow for many results
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8184

In selfhost, search for `editor` and replace with something. Run a profile while doing the operation. When looking at the profile, I see half of the time spend in `Tokenizer.tokenize`:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/16418386/e27637ce-3d49-11e6-99ab-731d7c1b3fc3.png)

[CPU-20160628T160331.cpuprofile.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/337183/CPU-20160628T160331.cpuprofile.zip)

I am not sure why we need to run the tokenize even though we are not even opening the editors?

data.title: Provide completion proposals for variables in launch.json

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be great of there are completion proposals for variables in launch.json.
That's now quite easy to add, check out https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/extensions/configuration-editing/src/extension.ts.
This adds completions to keybindings.json.

You could add yourself also to the 'configuration-editing' extension, as launch is also a configuration file.

data.title: Search: did we loose the upper limit for search results?
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8184

When I now search for "e" in our workspace I seem to get all the results back? I think as long as I am not replacing, it is fine to cut the results as we used to.

data.title: type check all in `internal` projects

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
re #8203

> Test how sufficient that strategy is.

I think it's insufficient to not do project validation for non-external module projects. We shouldn't make that decision for the user but allow to configure what to do when. Not all projects are large and type check slowly. Also we have a good queue so it might not be as impact full as we think

data.title: Monaco editor page could have some revisions
data.body:
ref: #8229

I like the simplicity and content of https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/index.html
However I feel like the sentences could be improved by a native speaker - editor. This includes the description at https://www.npmjs.com/package/monaco-editor
So assigning this to @gregvanl so he takes a quick look at the site content.

ping @alexandrudima

data.title: Problems: selecting problem should highlight problem line in editor
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7601:

Single clicking an item in the problems view reveals the problem in the editor.
But if the problem is only flagged with a squiggly for a single character, it is very difficult to spot the problem.

In the example below try to quickly spot the problem in the editor after the item has been selected in the problems view:

![2016-06-28_15-34-11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/16417389/f6e0bd14-3d45-11e6-931f-c7c862322646.gif)

It would be helpful if the line of the problem could be highlighted briefly.

data.title: Dragging a folder onto the empty spaces opens the currently selected file
data.body:
testing #7852
- Close all editors
- Select a file that in a folder that you will not drag in the next step
- drag and drop a folder from the explorer

Acceptance feedback is shown and the result of dropping a folder is to open the currently selected file in the explorer. This is surprising. I would have expected that no drop acceptance feedback is shown and nothing happens.
